in.teramatrix.flint.driver.fragment

Class TicketFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • in.teramatrix.flint.driver.fragment.TicketFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap.CancelableCallback, com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap.OnMarkerClickListener, com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback, com.sothree.slidinguppanel.SlidingUpPanelLayout.PanelSlideListener, okhttp3.Callback
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CloseTicketFragment, OpenTicketFragment

    public abstract class TicketFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
implements com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback, okhttp3.Callback, android.view.View.OnClickListener, com.sothree.slidinguppanel.SlidingUpPanelLayout.PanelSlideListener, com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap.OnMarkerClickListener, com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap.CancelableCallback
    Class has been written to present ticket/task details in well manner. First of all, A JsonObject containing task details will be loaded. It can be obtained from the getArgument() method of Fragment class because the previous fragment TicketListFragment will bundle task data in arguments. If it is null, it mean, task details will be loaded from the api.

    In the first case, everything is easy to load because data is coming from previous Fragment but in another case, First data will be loaded from the api with GoogleMap loading asynchronously.

    One more thing to be notice is that, Driver can update task status here in this version.

    Author:
    Mohsin Khan
    Date:
    14/9/2016
